title: Memoir of Robert Chambers /
author: Chambers, William
snippet: Her son, Sir William, a boy fourteen years of age, instead of being bred to one of the ' learned professions,' was put apprentice to Messrs Coutts ; from an apprentice, he became a junior clerk ; from a clerk, he rose to be a partner; and finally, when several of the partners died or quitted Edinburgh, the firm was transformed into that of Sir William Forbes & Co., of which he was the leading member. The firm, as is well known, is now merged in the Union Bank of Scotland.

title: A Tour in Tartan-Land
author: Bede, Cuthbert
snippet: Union Bank of Scotland, modelled after the Roman Temple of Jupiter Stator, at once attracts the eye. George Street is another fine street, and would be still finer if the church, that now divides it into two, was removed to its extremest point.

title: Memorials of Edinburgh in the olden time
author: Wilson, Daniel
snippet: 1 Now incorporated with other Banking Companies, under the name of the Union Bank of Scotland.

title: Days of the past;
author: Shand, Alexander Innes
snippet: It was in this wise. I had a dozen or so of shares in the Union Bank of Scotland, when they fell ominously in a wild burst of panic. With all sorts of sinister rumours in the air, it seemed even betting on a smash.
